file_content.text: Get this Jedi off my holo, Lanklyn. Now.
I--I can't. Xerender has overridden all my controls!
As you can see, Baras, I control this planet. I've tapped your communications and can anticipate your every move.
As Commander Lanklyn knows firsthand, the Talz keep me one step ahead of even you.
So, this is the Jedi I'm going to kill.
You're dead, Xerender.
Your oversized commandos are on the verge of extinction.
The Talz are a dying breed.
Ah, the lap dog returns.
If your trainer knows what's good for him, he'll muzzle you.
I've never seen you speechless, Master.
At a loss for words, Baras?
I have. If only I'd taken the opportunity to shut him up permanently.
I'm not here for a reunion, Baras. The last time we met, you were left drained and weaponless. This time, you won't be so lucky.
My lord, I--I'm sorry, I--
You have failed me for the last time, Lanklyn.
Ensign Slinte, you are now the coordinator of my dealings on Hoth. Don't screw it up. Commander.
I will not... disappoint you... my lord.
Apprentice, you better have good news for me.
I'm ready to report.
You can always count on me, master.
The sun is about to shine.
Save your strong arm tactics for the grunts.
Or what?
The lost super weapon Xerender seeks is actually a Jedi Master named Wyellett.
Ah, Master Wyellett. Now I understand why Xerender would risk exposure.
Before his capture during the war, Wyellett was among the Jedi's most powerful Masters.
The ship transporting him to me was destroyed in a fierce space battle in this system. I assumed he'd perished, but....
The ship must have crashed here on Hoth, and he's kept himself alive all this time.
Apparently, he survived.
So it would seem. For beings that commune deeply enough, the Force can be as sustaining as rations.
Why hasn't he been found before now?
Seems preposterous.
That is the next part of the mystery.
Apparently, the great Darth Baras is not immune to blunders himself.
You blew it.
All beings blunder. I have survived my mistakes. Will you?
During the war, Xerender was Master Wyellett's Padawan. We battled. Wyellett took my lightsaber and used it from then on.
If Wyellett is on Hoth, so is my blade. I will concentrate to locate it.... Yes, there! Coordinates sent, Commander. Now go, apprentice. Find the lightsaber and the Jedi!
My lord, the area indicated is an uncharted quadrant where blackmarketeers are said to operate.
What will you have me do while you are away?
Dispose of Lanklyn's body. Commander.
Clean this place up.
Be ready if I need you. Commander.
Await instructions.
That's all I need. Commander.
You've done enough.
The Emperor's speed to you, my lord.
I'll await your update at the Imperial outpost. We can contact Baras after you've invaded the Talz headquarters.
Jedi Xerender is a crafty adversary. I thought I was tracking him and his men, when I found myself led into a pirate ambush.
It seems he had the Republic's elite Talz commandos lure me off his trail. The Talz are unmatched trackers, highly cunning.
So, you know nothing of Xerender's mission or destination?
Did you learn anything useful?
Well, I suppose practically speaking, that is the case.
Could have happened to anyone.
Don't beat yourself up.
I'm sorry, my lord, but this means that I have no concrete leads.
Xerender outsmarted you, and you failed your mission.
That's no excuse.
I have no idea how he knew. I did everything right.
I can tell you this--if Xerender's been given command of the Talz, this weapon he's after must be supremely important.
I know where the Talz headquarters is located. Maybe you can force one of them to confess what Xerender is after?
If I have to kill every Talz on this planet, I will get what I need.
They'll confess.
I suppose that will have to suffice.
It's not much to go on.
I wish there was more I could do.
Tell me more about the Talz.
What am I up against?
They're strong, stealthy and lethal. Oversized, white hairy beasts that thrive in the cold.
They practically disappear in the snow, so you don't know they're there until they've attacked. I wish you luck against them.
Just try not to get captured again.
Worry about yourself.
Rest assured, my lord, you won't need to save me again.
Thanks for the warning.
I don't need luck.
Far be it for me to disagree.
I hope this lead makes up for my... blunder.
I'll rendezvous with you at the outpost in the next sector, and we can update Lord Baras.
My lord, is that you? I heard the sounds of battle outside and grew hopeful.
Rise to your feet, Commander; you're freed.
I've come to save you.
Sorry for this trouble. But truth is, my capture gives us great insight into the enemy.
Just tell me everything you know about Jedi Knight Xerender.
Don't waste time with chatter.
Yes, my lord.
Your capture is a disgrace. You're lucky I don't gut you right here.
I should kill you.
Please, my lord, I beg your tolerance.
